body:
Trying to `spack install julia` and `spack install julia@1.3.1` result in failures that end something like this:

```
[...]
  /tmp/hartzell/spack-stage/spack-stage-julia-1.4.0-54ipg6rhp7kuc6vd7btj7ikxiue7vq6l/spack-src/src/codegen.cpp: In function 'std::unique_ptr<llvm::Module> emit_function(jl_method_instance_t*, jl_code_info_t*, jl_valu
e_t*, size_t, jl_llvm_functions_t*, const jl_cgparams_t*)':
/tmp/hartzell/spack-stage/spack-stage-julia-1.4.0-54ipg6rhp7kuc6vd7btj7ikxiue7vq6l/spack-src/src/codegen.cpp:6597:34: warning: 'retval' may be used uninitialized in this function [-Wmaybe-uninitialized]
             ctx.builder.CreateRet(retval);
             ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~~~~~~
    LINK usr/lib/libjulia.so.1.4
Warning: git information unavailable; versioning information limited
    CC ui/repl.o
    LINK usr/bin/julia
Warning: git information unavailable; versioning information limited
    JULIA usr/lib/julia/corecompiler.ji
ERROR: Invalid CPU name skylake_avx512.
make[1]: *** [/tmp/hartzell/spack-stage/spack-stage-julia-1.4.0-54ipg6rhp7kuc6vd7btj7ikxiue7vq6l/spack-src/usr/lib/julia/corecompiler.ji] Error 1
make: *** [julia-sysimg-ji] Error 2
```

The discussion in this Julia bug report, https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/30850, and the linked [discourse thread](https://discourse.julialang.org/t/invalid-cpu-name-x86-64-error-when-building-with-march-x86-64/20115/5) indirectly suggest that Julia's trying to run a C compiler and is picking up my system's `gcc@4.8.5` (CentOS 7) instead of the `gcc@8.4.0` that I'm using.

Here's the spec:

```

Concretized

                    ^readline@8.0%gcc@8.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
            ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@8.4.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
    ^m4@1.4.18%gcc@8.4.0 patches=3877ab548f88597ab2327a2230ee048d2d07ace1062efe81fc92e91b7f39cd00,fc9b61654a3ba1a8d6cd78ce087e7c96366c290bc8d2c299f09828d793b853c8 +sigsegv arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512

        ^bzip2@1.0.8%gcc@8.4.0+shared arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
            ^diffutils@3.7%gcc@8.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
```

title: Julia build fails with "ERROR: Invalid CPU name skylake_avx512."
